questions.question_text:
The Products sold by Universal Containers (UC) have a Product Family of Hardware or Software. Each Quote should only contain one of the Product Families. At the time of Quote creation, the sales rep is required to populate a custom picklist with the API name Family__c with values of Hardware or Software.
If the sales rep selects Hardware for the Family__c field, the rep should only be able to add Products with the Product Family of Hardware to the Quote. The same premise applies for the value Software for the Family__c field.
How should the Admin meet this requirement?

discussion.content:

Has to be A. Your target object has to be Product not Quote.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers requires that all users add at least one Product Option from the Maintenance Feature to a bundle. Additionally, users must select at least one and no more than two Product Options from the Support Feature.
How should the Admin set up these requirements for the users?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C is correct
D is Correct. You should not mention maximum number.

choices.B: Set Max Options for Maintenance to one. Set Min Options to one and Max Options to two for Support.
choices.D: Set Min Options for Maintenance to one. Set Min Options to zero and Max Options to two for Support.
choices.A: Set Min Options and Max Options to zero for Maintenance. Set Min Options to zero and Max Options to two for Support.
choices.C: Set Min Options for Maintenance to one. Set Min Options to one and Max Options to two for Support.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct.

questions.question_text:
Universal Containers provides a discount for an enterprise-level customer if a single line’s Net Price is above a certain threshold. The Admin has set up a Price Rule with a reference to a custom formula field on the Price Condition to apply the discount automatically. The user has to click Calculate twice for the discount to apply.
What is the most likely cause of the issue?

choices.B: The referenced formula field contains information that has yet to be calculated, so the Price Rule fires the second time it’s evaluated.
choices.A: The Evaluation Scope of the Price Rule is set incorrectly to fire on the Configurator, so the Price Rule fires the Configure Products page.
choices.D: The referenced formula field contains date/time data information that is unsupported, so the Price Rule fires sporadically.
choices.C: The use of formula fields in Price Conditions is unsupported, so the Price Rule fires and returns an error the first time.

BC and E
